“The Sanctum, and Kjorikos, like I said.” You smile. “But also, about Freakshow and their leader.”

“Anaximander.” Ayla says. “You know him?”

“I'm surprised anyone does.” You respond. “He seems like an elusive one. My party and I had a brief skirmish with him in the city, before the riots were over.”

“What? I don't believe it.” She folds her arms. “What happened?”

“He's powerful. Armed to the teeth with weapons and spells, and a katana that causes some sort of stunning effect on contact.” You respond. “In addition, he's wielding a Celestial Artifact that allows him to teleport at will.”

“Liza informed us. It's troubling. Do you know how far he can reach?” She asks.

“Far.” You respond. “I'm not sure what the limit is, or if he even has one. My party and I have been concerned, as he appears to be using it to orchestrate ambush groups.”

“We discussed the possibility.” Ayla responds. “The Guardians are fixated on driving Freakshow out of Averron, but we've elected not to move until we've reached a consensus. I'm trying to push for neutrality, but given I've been a part of more than one of their attacks now, I'm inclined to join the cause.”

“I don't think I'm in a position to arbitrate.” You nod.

“Right, then. What about Kjorikos?” She asks. “This, I want to hear.”

“He was the first Artificer, or some such. Condemned for supposedly heretical practices—something about pioneering 'aerheric' stuff?” A chill runs down your spine as you remember the fortune-teller's words.

“Aetheric...” Ayla says. “That's a word I want to hear right now. Go on.”
